item.title: Dell introduces new laptops and monitors
item.description: Dell Singapore has launched new laptops and a monitor for consumers. The XPS 12 is the first 2-in-1 laptop with a 4K Ultra HD display. The Inspiron 11 3000 series offers an affordable and portable laptop option available in three colors. Dell also released their first 4K consumer monitor, the Dell 28 Ultra HD 4K Monitor. “Consumers have increasingly diverse needs. Whether it’s a student or a professional, size, power, design, and price all matter.

item.title: Blackmagic Design presents 4K Pocket Cinema Camera and DaVinci Resolve 15 at Broadcast Asia
item.description: Source: Blackmagic Design. Camera, video editing software slated for an Asia Pacific launch at Broadcast Asia. Blackmagic Design is introducing the Pocket Cinema Camera 4K and DaVinci Resolve 15 to the Asia Pacific market at Broadcast Asia. Though intended for professional filmmakers, the line between pro-grade gear and high-end solutions for business or personal use is becoming increasingly blurred. “Blackmagic Design is committed to making top-tier video production accessible to everyone, fostering a truly creative post-production and television industry,” remarked Grant Petty, Blackmagic Design CEO.

item.title: The Ultra-HD 4K L9450 Pro Theatre TVs from Toshiba are suitable for both living rooms and boardrooms
item.description: Toshiba’s new Ultra-HD 4K L9450 series, featuring Android Pro Theatre TVs, blends exceptional picture quality with a wide array of downloadable Android apps from Google Play. These TVs double as computer monitors, making them ideal for business conference rooms. With the convenience of Android apps, presentations can be downloaded directly to the TV’s memory and displayed on screen, eliminating the need for separate presentation equipment. Additionally, wireless mice, keyboards, and gamepads can be used for control, supplementing the standard remote*.

item.title: Asus introduces a portable LED projector with a 4K display
item.description: The PB287Q is a 28-inch monitor with 4K ultra high definition. At CES last week, Asus, known for its consumer notebooks and motherboards, introduced new products designed for content creators and mobile professionals seeking enhanced performance and affordability. The company emphasized delivering bigger, better, and faster solutions. Among their offerings is the PB287Q, a 28-inch display with 4K ultra high definition (UHD) resolution. This slim-profile monitor features a full range of adjustments including swivel, tilt, pivot, and height, along with Splendid Plus video intelligence technology for optimal viewing comfort.
